sub_title: Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD
summary:
As a professional learning development specialist focusing on languages with 6 years of experience, I work with young adults and professionals in both academic and industrial settings. I support them to make better improvements in their work, not only in overcoming language barriers, but also in better understanding their roles and goals. I work on innovating teaching methods, I am also skilled in competency-based learning and development, training design, training needs analysis, developing training solutions, training evaluation and stakeholder management.

I completed a PhD in language teaching development to create a more effective model of language learning in Hungarian to help the integration of foreigners. As a certified language teacher and mentor, I seek to find the best ways to teach Hungarian language to real-life situations. 

I am experienced in working in offline, online and hybrid environments. I have a strong interest in innovation. 

In volunteer programmes, I also work as a coach and trainer coordinator with international communities, creating a platform for international doctoral students for their integration in Hungary. As the founder of the Talented Youth Workshop Association, I work on improving the supportive environment for young talented artists, finding the best trainers, organising skill-building workshops, summarising feedback and providing financial resources. 

I have experience working with a variety of partners in academic, scientific, industrial and cultural fields. I have excellent communication and organisational skills, I am enthusiastic, creative and results-oriented. I am also skilled in project management, stakeholder management, and managing and adapting to business change.

projects.title: Ambassador System at Association of Hungarian PhD and DLA Candidates (DOSZ)
projects.description: Building an international community of PhD candidates in Hungary. In the last decade there is a rapidly growing number of international PhD candidates in Hungary: in the Association of Hungarian Phd and DLA Candidates (DOSZ), we are building a representation system, currently with 37 countries' ambassadors from 4 continents. We are organizing international programs, dealing with integration, cultural and language barriers, scientific cooperation, student representation and community budilding.

contributors.headline: Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD

projects.title: Cultural Networks in Central Europe (Berlin)
projects.description:
Project-coordinator from ELTE, Budapest and lecturer.
The event was realized within the framework of CENTRAL, a cooperation between the Humboldt University of Berlin, the universities of Vienna and Warsaw, Charles University Prague as well as ELTE Budapest.
The main goal of the workshop was to explore and to document cultural networks in the Central European region. Each participating student presented research results concerning a cultural contact or network between their own country and Hungary over the last 30 years - such as scientific or artistic cooperations, adaptations in literature or art, creative activities beyond borders etc. This means that students from Berlin explored German-Hungarian networks, students from Warsaw Polish-Hungarian networks etc.

contributors.headline: Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD

projects.title: Language and Culture in Language Teaching (Beijing)
projects.description:
Lecturer and workshop leader on a 2 days long methodological conference for teachers of Hungarian in China located at Beijing Foreign Studies University. Joint lectures with Katalin Szili for Hungarian teachers in China. 
Lectures and workshops held by me: 
- Grammar in the Process of Teaching Hungarian Studies
- Teaching Materials in Hungarian Studies

contributors.headline: Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD

projects.title: Hungarian Language in Theory and Practicw (Berlin, Warsaw, Prague, Budapest)
projects.description:
Student, lecturer, Hungarian as a second language teacher.
The workshops took place in every year on an other university (Berlin, Warsaw, Prague, Budapest).
Main goals of the project:
1. Research collaboration between researchers and teachers of Hungarian studies
2. Mutual support of students’ final projects and dissertations in the field of Hungarian language and cultural studies as well as language education
3. Mutual enabling of supported teaching work placements for student teachers of Hungarian studies

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for designing and implementing effective training programs for various target groups, ensuring the highest standards of quality while handling various projects. Also, monitoring course activities and evaluating training success for continuous improvement.

•	Successfully designed and implemented training programs for Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship groups, Intensive Hungarian Foundation Courses, topic-focused groups, and Erasmus+ groups 
•	Developed participants’ skills in different skills, regarding communication, cooperation, and cultural understanding
•	Developed training solutions and instructional designs to meet the needs of a wide range of target groups 
•	Used newest methods and focused on the useful knowledge for foreigner groups 
•	Demonstrated the system of the language and culture in an effective manner; translated complex content into simple and effective training materials
•	Organised and monitored course activities, ensuring the highest standards of quality 
•	Employed competency-based learning and development and training needs analysis  
•	Created digital contents, including interactive presentations, animations, and images 
•	Managed projects, coordinated and developed training programs 
•	Provided exceptional didactic knowledge and attention to detail 
•	Organised extra-curricular, cultural activities for ensuring and motivating participants in learning
•	Supervised junior trainers and mentors
•	Utilised excellent communication skills in English
profile_positions.title: Learning And Development Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for building and managing the international doctoral candidate's community in Hungary created by the Association (as board member, from 2023 as a vice-president for foreign affairs and responsible for the Ambassador Project). 

•	Successfully established a representation system, engaging 37 countries from 4 continents for the academic year 2022/2023
•	Proven track record in project management, coordination, and development of training programs, in collaboration with subject matter experts
•	Established and managed five working groups focusing on mental health, inclusion, communication, internal improvement, and scientific cooperation
•	Demonstrated effectiveness in training evaluation and continuous improvement
•	Mentored representatives to organize scientific and cultural events, like conferences, workshops, webinars
•	Motivated volunteers with different methods to ensure the work of the system
•	Communicated in English in speaking and writing, prepared materials, presentations and trainings in English
•	Advised representatives in questions caused by cultural differences in order to ensure the same understanding
•	Managed and communicated with stakeholder from the civil, academic and governmental sector
•	Supervised social media contents and descriptions of events
profile_positions.title: Talent Engagement Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for developing courses, establishing course objectives and learning outcomes, planning and delivering lessons, assessing and evaluating student progress, and using multimedia and other teaching materials.

•	Designed and delivered courses based on student needs and levels regarding Hungarian language and culture
•	Translated complex content into simple and effective training material 
•	Implemented interactive activities, created digital content, and incorporated cultural aspects of the language 
•	Adapted training approaches to meet the needs of a wide range of target groups
•	Monitored and supported student progress and provided feedback and encouragement 
•	Developed course objectives and learning outcomes
profile_positions.title: Hungarian as a Second Language Teacher and Course Developer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for evaluating quality assurance of doctoral schools and higher education institutions as a trained expert of the Hungarian Higher Education Accreditation Commission, which is a national expert body that helps to monitor, ensure and evaluate the scientific quality of training, scientific research and artistic creativity in higher education.

• Evaluated for improvement in the institution's curriculum, instruction, faculty, and student services, resulting in increased compliance with European accreditation standards of ENQA
• Conducted surveys, interviews, and research to assess the effectiveness of the institution's educational goals and objectives, and presented findings and recommendations to the institution's governing body
• Evaluated the institution's technology and information systems and recommended changes for improved performance
• Monitored the institution's progress and presented recommendations for improvement
• Evaluated training programs and devised continuous improvement plans for maximum effectiveness
profile_positions.title: Evaluation Specialist

profile_positions.title: Business Development Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for teaching Hungarian language and culture in groups of international companies and preparing participants for international challenges. In the focus of the courses there are the basics of Hungarian, the useful everyday cultural knowledge and office communication.

• Successfully designed and delivered a comprehensive Hungarian language learning program
• Facilitated language learning through engaging and effective teaching techniques resulting in students achieving their learning goals
• Prepared participants for the cultural and language challenges of the industrial field
• Developed materials and utilized technology and multimedia resources to enhance the learning experience
• Assessed students’ progress and adjusted teaching plans to student needs and expactation of the companies
• Maintained relationships with the HR departments of the companies, providing guidance and support
• Remained up-to-date with the latest teaching trends and innovations
• Established a safe and supportive learning environment for participants
• Communicated and prepared teaching materials in English

Developing the comprehension skills of the deaf using the methods of Hungarian as a foreign language.

Responsible for teaching Hungarian language and culture in groups of international companies and preparing participants for international challenges. In the focus of the courses there are the basics of Hungarian, the useful everyday cultural knowledge and office communication.

• Designed and delivered courses based on student needs and levels regarding Hungarian language and the deaf society culture
• Translated complex content into simple and effective training material 
• Monitored and supported student progress and provided feedback and encouragement 
• Developed course objectives and learning outcomes
• Facilitated language learning through engaging and effective teaching techniques resulting in students achieving their learning goals
• Assessed students’ progress and adjusted teaching plans to student needs 
• Maintained relationships with the association, providing guidance and support
• Established a safe and supportive learning environment for participants
• Communicated and prepared teaching materials in groups, working closely together with specialist of the deaf culture and translators
